title: Logical conjunction
summary: In logic, mathematics and linguistics, And ( ∧ {\displaystyle \wedge } ) is the truth-functional operator of logical conjunction; the and of a set of operands is true if and only if all of its operands are true. The logical connective that represents this operator is typically written as ∧ {\displaystyle \wedge } or  ⋅ .[1][2]
